stories.text:
I'm building a bookmarker extension and its crapping out when people try to import 40K bookmarks. I never considered people would have that many bookmarks!

I'm wondering how many I need to be able to handle to take on the biggest bookmark hoarder out there.
stories.title: Ask HN: Who Has the Most Bookmarks?
The Fat Gold guide to extra virgin olive oil

Zoom Video Communications, Inc. Privacy Litigation

stories.text:
pytest-mongodb https://github.com/mdomke/pytest-mongodb#migration-from-humongous requires 3 variables to be defined in pytest.ini these variables are already used in the code as environment variables. It doesn't make sense to duplicate the code in pytest.ini

I saw that https://pypi.org/project/pytest-env/ let's you define environment variables but this isn't very intelligent since it's only one way. I want it to read and in pytest.ini e.g

[pytest] x=$blah

Are there any packages that can do this?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there Python package that can read environment variables
The Dark Side of Saying Work Is ‘Like a Family’
